_metadata.description: Comprehensive specifications for Bitcoin home mining devices
notes: Temperatures marked as 'chip_temp' refer to ASIC die/junction temperatures, not ambient.
Temperatures marked as 'ambient_operating' refer to recommended room/environment temperatures.
Hashrate values are at default/stock settings unless noted as overclocked.
Power consumption is wall power unless noted otherwise.
All devices mine SHA-256 algorithm (Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, etc.).

bitaxe_original.name: BitAxe (Original)
bitaxe_original.notes: First open-source Bitcoin ASIC miner. Used two BM1387 chips in series. Superseded by BitAxe Max.

bitaxe_max.name: BitAxe Max (100 Series)
bitaxe_max.notes: World's first open-source single-chip Bitcoin ASIC miner. Uses BM1397 from Antminer S17. EMC2101 measures chip internal diode temperature and controls fan PWM.

bitaxe_ultra.name: BitAxe Ultra (200 Series)

voltage.notes: Adjustable via Maxim DS4432U+ current DAC (0.04V to 2.4V range)

bitaxe_ultra.notes: 3rd major BitAxe revision. BM1366 rolls more than just the nonce on-chip. EMC2101 temp sensor placed close to ASIC (BM1366 does not support die temp directly). Found multiple solo blocks in 2024-2025.

bitaxe_supra.name: BitAxe Supra (400 Series)

fan.notes: Noctua NF-A4x20 5V 4-Pin recommended upgrade. With Argon THRML cooler: up to 900 GH/s at 55C max.

voltage.notes: Adjustable via Maxim DS4432U+ current DAC (0.04V to 2.4V range)

bitaxe_supra.power_input: 5V DC, 5.5x2.1mm barrel jack. UL-certified 5V/6A (30W) PSU included.
bitaxe_supra.notes: 4th major BitAxe revision. Uses BM1368 from Antminer S21. 4-layer PCB design.

bitaxe_gamma.name: BitAxe Gamma (600 Series)

temperature.notes: Keep below 65C for 24/7 operation. VR and MOSFETs can exceed safe temps quickly during overclocking.

frequency.notes: OC from 525MHz to 900MHz yields 1.07-1.84 TH/s. Increase in 25-50MHz steps with 25-50mV voltage bumps.

voltage.notes: Stock: 525 MHz at 1150 mV. Adjustable via DS4432U+ current DAC.

bitaxe_gamma.notes: 5th major BitAxe revision. BM1370 from Antminer S21 Pro. Most efficient single-chip open-source miner available. USB-C for firmware updates.

bitaxe_hex_ultra.name: BitAxe Hex Ultra (300 Series)
bitaxe_hex_ultra.notes: 6-chip chain design. Arctic P8 fan with minimalist frame. Quiet enough for home mining.

bitaxe_hex_supra.name: BitAxe Supra Hex (700 Series)

frequency.notes: Typical setting: 550MHz at 1250mV

bitaxe_hex_supra.display: HD LED display for real-time monitoring
bitaxe_hex_supra.notes: 6-chip BM1368 chain. Upgraded 80mm dual ball bearing fan. ~4.2 TH/s at 550MHz/1250mV draws ~90W.

nerdaxe.name: NerdAxe

voltage.notes: Adjustable via Maxim DS4432U+ current DAC

nerdaxe.notes: Upgrade from NerdMiner project. Transforms NerdMiners from 56 KH/s to 500 GH/s. Uses TPS40305 buck regulator, DS4432U+ DAC, INA260 power meter, EMC2101 fan control. Available as upgrade kit or full kit.

nerdaxe_gamma.name: NerdAxe Gamma
nerdaxe_gamma.notes: NerdAxe platform upgraded to BM1370 chip. Same 1.2 TH/s as BitAxe Gamma 601 but with NerdAxe form factor and 1.9in color display. Uses TPS546D buck regulator, DS4432U+ DAC, EMC2101 fan controller.

nerdqaxe_plus.name: NerdQAxe+
nerdqaxe_plus.notes: Quad-chip BM1368 design. Original QAxe used BM1366 (4 chips), NerdQAxe+ upgraded to BM1368. Supports dual-pool mining with hashrate splitting.

nerdqaxe_plusplus.name: NerdQAxe++

temperature.notes: Remastered edition stabilizes at 65C after 72hr continuous run at 25C ambient. Rev 6.1 improved copper traces lower board temps by 21.4%.

frequency.notes: Danger Zone OC can push to ~700MHz for 6.2-6.5 TH/s at 110-115W

nerdqaxe_plusplus.form_factor: Standalone enclosed unit with metal stand
nerdqaxe_plusplus.display: 1.9in LCD color screen with 2 programmable buttons
nerdqaxe_plusplus.notes: World's first open-source quad-chip BM1370 miner. Rev 6.1: no fuse, XT30 connector, thicker copper traces, 1oz copper layout, spring-mounted heatsink, relocated temp sensors. Supports dual-pool mining. Beast Mode firmware for ~6 TH/s. Weight: 0.4 kg.

nerdoctaxe.name: NerdOctaxe Gamma
nerdoctaxe.asic_chip_source: Antminer S21 Pro / S21+ / S21+ Hydro

fan.type: Dual Thermalright AXP90 X53 Black Low Profile coolers
fan.notes: Intel LGA115x and AMD AM4 mounting pattern

nerdoctaxe.display: LILYGO T-Display S3, 1.9in LCD color screen with 2 programmable buttons
nerdoctaxe.notes: 8-chip BM1370 design, based on NerdQAxe architecture. Most powerful Nerd-series miner. ~$26/month electricity at $0.20/kWh. Supports dual-pool mining.

luckyminer_lv06.name: LuckyMiner LV06
luckyminer_lv06.notes: Plug-and-play BM1366 miner. Hardware encryption for mining data. Supports 42 SHA-256 coins. Merged mining BTC+Fractal Bitcoin. Real-time monitoring via WiFi device.

luckyminer_lv07.name: LuckyMiner LV07

fan.notes: Fan can reach ~58 dB at high RPM

luckyminer_lv07.noise_notes: Can reach ~58 dB at high RPM
luckyminer_lv07.notes: Dual-chip design. Supports BTC+Fractal Bitcoin merged mining. Various pool mining modes (SOLO, PPLNS, PPS, PROP).

luckyminer_lv08.name: LuckyMiner LV08
luckyminer_lv08.notes: 4.5x hashrate of LV07 in a still-compact form factor.

gekkoscience_compac_f.name: GekkoScience Compac F

temperature.notes: NO built-in temperature sensor. Rule of thumb: if heatsink is not too hot to touch, chip is OK. Aim for under 80C when overclocking.

fan.notes: External active cooling REQUIRED. IglooPac fan shroud upgrade recommended.

frequency.notes: Not stable below 300 MHz. Start at 400, increase 25 MHz at a time. CGMiner flag: --gekko-compacf-freq

voltage.notes: Small Phillips-head screw. 1 o'clock = lowest, 11 o'clock = highest, 12 o'clock = reset. Turn clockwise ~30 degrees if frequency won't reach target.

gekkoscience_compac_f.interface: CGMiner API (via USB to host computer)
gekkoscience_compac_f.noise_notes: Silent (no fan), but external fan needed for active cooling
gekkoscience_compac_f.notes: Designed and assembled in USA. Requires powered USB hub (2-5A per port recommended). Loves overclocking - built for it. No temperature sensor in device.

gekkoscience_compac_a1.name: GekkoScience Compac A1

temperature.notes: HAS integrated temperature sensor (unlike Compac F). Telemetry data available in CGMiner terminal.

fan.type: No built-in fan (passive heatsink with integrated 2-pin fan header)
fan.notes: Integrated 2-pin fan socket, compatible with IcePac snap-on cooler. Active cooling strongly recommended for overclocking.

frequency.notes: Software-controlled clock rate and core voltage adjustment during operation via console parameters or Java API. --gekko-compaca1-freq flag in CGMiner.

voltage.notes: First GekkoScience USB miner with software-controlled voltage (no manual potentiometer). Adjustable via CGMiner console parameters or Java API.

gekkoscience_compac_a1.interface: CGMiner API (via USB to host computer)
gekkoscience_compac_a1.noise_notes: Silent (no built-in fan), but external cooling needed
gekkoscience_compac_a1.notes: Successor to Compac F. Dual BM1362 ASICs with 70% less power consumption than Compac F at equivalent hashrate. First GekkoScience USB miner with integrated temperature sensor and software voltage control. Designed and assembled in USA. First product in new A-series line.

gekkoscience_terminus_r909.name: GekkoScience Terminus R909

temperature.notes: NO built-in temperature sensor - chip temp not displayed in CGMiner. 40% larger heatsink area vs previous models.

frequency.notes: Conservatively set at 400 MHz default for 1.5-1.6 TH/s. Safe OC to 550 MHz (~2.0 TH/s) without hardware mods.

voltage.notes: Adjustable per chip, similar to Compac F

gekkoscience_terminus_r909.interface: CGMiner API (via USB to host computer)
gekkoscience_terminus_r909.power_input: 12V DC via 2.1/5.5mm barrel plug (8A rated) or 6-pin PCIe
gekkoscience_terminus_r909.noise_notes: Near-silent with enclosed shell and 80mm fan
gekkoscience_terminus_r909.notes: Designed and assembled in USA. Released Dec 2022. Requires external controller (Raspberry Pi 4 handles 2 units, 12th gen i5 handles 9 units). Compatible with Windows, Mac OS, Linux, Ubuntu, Raspberry Pi. Improved thermal management with redesigned layout.

futurebit_apollo_btc.name: FutureBit Apollo BTC

fan.type: 25mm custom fan with cold-forged aluminum heatsink

frequency.notes: Managed by internal firmware, user-selectable via Eco/Turbo modes

futurebit_apollo_btc.power_input: 200W PSU (proprietary FutureBit PSU limited to ~3 TH/s; external 300W+ needed for 3.8 TH/s)
futurebit_apollo_btc.notes: Made in USA. Runs full non-pruned Bitcoin node. 44 ASIC hash cores under custom cold-forged aluminum induction heatsink. World's first vertically integrated Bitcoin full node + miner in desktop form factor.

futurebit_apollo_ii.name: FutureBit Apollo II

fan.type: 1K-7K RPM low noise dual ball bearing fan with custom vapor chamber heatsink
fan.notes: Vapor chamber dissipates 2x the output of Gen 1

frequency.notes: Managed by internal firmware, user-selectable via Eco/Turbo modes

futurebit_apollo_ii.notes: 4x hashrate, 2x efficiency, 3x hashrate-per-dollar vs Gen 1. Built-in stratum solo pool toggle. Can connect external miners to increase solo block chances. Made in USA.

bitmain_antrouter_r1.name: Bitmain AntRouter R1-BTC

frequency.notes: Fixed, not user-adjustable

bitmain_antrouter_r1.notes: Dual-function: WiFi router + Bitcoin miner. Forces AntPool Solo mode. 5.5 GH/s is negligible for modern mining. Also functions as USB charger (5V/2A). Can connect U3 miners via USB hub. WiFi: 150Mbps transmission rate.

antminer_s9.name: Bitmain Antminer S9

space_heater_mode.notes: With Braiins OS in space heater configuration. ~9 TH/s at 700W, 32 dB. Increase power target by ~80W for +1 TH/s.

temperature.notes: IMPORTANT: BM1387 chip temps of 85-100C are NORMAL operating range per Bitmain specs. Below 85C = cool. 85-100C = normal. 100-110C = monitor carefully. 115C = auto-cutoff. At 25C ambient, chips sit ~70C with boards ~45C. At 40C ambient, chips reach ~90C.

fan.notes: 70% fan speed sufficient even at 40C ambient. 50% fan speed (3000-3400 RPM) sufficient at 25C ambient.

frequency.notes: Each BM1387 provides ~74 GH/s at 650 MHz

antminer_s9.power_input: 10x 6-pin PCIe connectors for 12V DC (3 per hashboard + 1 controller)
antminer_s9.notes: Released July 2017. Most iconic Bitcoin ASIC miner ever. Can be immersion cooled or modified for home use with aftermarket mods. BM1387 chips available for $1-2 each. Popular for running custom firmware (Braiins OS). Can function as space heater at 700W/32 dB with Braiins OS. NOT suitable for home at stock settings without noise/heat management.

antminer_s19.name: Bitmain Antminer S19

temperature.notes: CRITICAL: Temperature impacts efficiency far more on S19 than older gens. Power consumption rises from 2.5kW at 20C to 3.55kW at 75C chip temp. Efficiency: 24 J/TH at 20C to 34 J/TH at 75C. PCB max temp: 75-80C (varies by sub-model). Firmware chip max: 95C (auto-shutdown). Ideal hashing: 70-85C chip, 3000-6500 RPM fan.

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled, adjustable via web UI

antminer_s19.notes: Released May 2020. NOT suitable for home without significant noise/heat mitigation. Requires dedicated 240V circuit. Can run Braiins OS for autotuning.

antminer_s19_pro.name: Bitmain Antminer S19 Pro
antminer_s19_pro.notes: NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation. Requires dedicated 240V circuit.

antminer_s19_xp.name: Bitmain Antminer S19 XP
antminer_s19_xp.notes: Released July 2022. Most efficient S19 variant. Same BM1366 chip used in BitAxe Ultra. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

antminer_s21.name: Bitmain Antminer S21

fan.type: 4x fans (dual aluminum heat sinks, front + rear fans)

antminer_s21.notes: Announced 2023, shipped 2024. Same BM1368 chip used in BitAxe Supra. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation. Requires dedicated 240V circuit.

antminer_s21_pro.name: Bitmain Antminer S21 Pro

temperature.notes: Slight hashrate decrease to ~225 TH/s at 45-50C ambient. Domain voltage ~1.04V.

antminer_s21_pro.notes: Released March 2024, shipped July 2024. Same BM1370 chip used in BitAxe Gamma and NerdQAxe++. Each chip does ~1.2 TH/s. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

antminer_s21_plus.name: Bitmain Antminer S21+
antminer_s21_plus.notes: NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

whatsminer_m30s.name: MicroBT Whatsminer M30S

temperature.notes: Power board temp 71-72C. Air inlet 25.6C -> outlet 60.4C.

whatsminer_m30s.notes: Released April 2020. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

whatsminer_m50s.name: MicroBT Whatsminer M50S
whatsminer_m50s.notes: Released July 2022. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

whatsminer_m60s.name: MicroBT Whatsminer M60S
whatsminer_m60s.power_input: 220-240V AC, P221B/P222B PSU, IEC C19 cable rated 16A+
whatsminer_m60s.notes: Released October 2023. Samsung 3nm GAA process confirmed by TechInsights (July 2023). NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

avalon_nano_3.name: Canaan Avalon Nano 3

temperature.notes: IMPORTANT: Canaan chips are designed for high-temperature operation. Chip temps of 70-90C are NORMAL and by design. Mining mode targets ~75C, heater mode targets ~90C. These chips perform BETTER at higher temperatures. Same high-temp-resistant chips as Avalon Miner A15 series.

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled based on operating mode

avalon_nano_3.interface: Canaan Web UI + Avalon Family App
avalon_nano_3.notes: Designed as dual-purpose miner/heater. Quiet enough for 24/7 home operation. Generates ~477 BTU/h of heat. Multiple operating modes with different chip temperature targets.

avalon_nano_3s.name: Canaan Avalon Nano 3S
avalon_nano_3s.asic_chip: Canaan proprietary (A-series, same family as A15 chips)

temperature.notes: CRITICAL: Chip temps of 75-95C are NORMAL and by design. This is NOT overheating. Canaan's high-temperature-resistant chips (same as A15 series) actually perform BETTER at higher temperatures. Mining mode: 75C target. Night mode: 80C target. Heater mode: 90C target. Do NOT treat these temps as alarm conditions.

fan.type: Internal air cooling with variable speed

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled based on operating mode and power mode (high/medium/low)

voltage.notes: Built-in PSU. Can operate on smaller PSUs in low power mode.

avalon_nano_3s.interface: Canaan Web UI + Avalon Family App
avalon_nano_3s.noise_notes: 33-40 dB typical, up to 50 dB in high fan modes
avalon_nano_3s.notes: 50% more hashrate than Nano 3 at same 140W. Generates ~477 BTU/h heat. Three power modes (140W/100W/65W). Designed as heater/miner for winter use. Altitude: decrease max operating temp by 1C per 300m above 900m.

avalon_mini_3.name: Canaan Avalon Mini 3

temperature.notes: CRITICAL: Same high-temp-resistant chips as A15 industrial miners. Chip temps of 75-90C are NORMAL by design. Mining Mode: 75C, Night Mode: 80C, Heater Mode: 90C.

mining.description: Maximum hashrate and efficiency, fans louder

heater_eco.description: Heating priority with mining, eco sub-mode

heater_super.description: Maximum heating with mining, super sub-mode

avalon_mini_3.interface: Canaan Web UI + Avalon Family App
avalon_mini_3.notes: Baseboard heater + Bitcoin miner hybrid. 800W heat output. Mining mode used year-round, heater mode for winter. Double-click switch button to toggle heater eco/super. Idle mode when room reaches target temperature.

avalon_q.name: Canaan Avalon Q

fan.type: Internal air cooling with variable speed

avalon_q.interface: Canaan Web UI + Avalon Family App
avalon_q.power_input: 110-240V AC (first pro-grade miner to support 110V worldwide)
avalon_q.notes: First professional-grade Bitcoin miner to support 110V home power worldwide. Three power modes (800W-1600W). Significantly quieter than S19/M30S (45-65 dB vs 75-85 dB). Adjustable power consumption 800-1600W. 360-day warranty. Approx $3.36/day income, ~$28.99/month profit at current conditions.

antminer_s21_xp_hyd.name: Bitmain Antminer S21 XP Hyd

temperature.notes: Hydro-cooled: much lower operating temps than air-cooled

antminer_s21_xp_hyd.noise_notes: Much quieter than air-cooled due to hydro cooling
antminer_s21_xp_hyd.notes: Most advanced S21 variant. Hydro cooling enables extreme efficiency (12 J/TH). Requires water cooling infrastructure. NOT practical for typical home use.

bitaxe_gamma_turbo_gt.name: BitAxe Gamma Turbo GT (800 Series)

fan.type: 60mm Noctua NF-A6x25 PWM + anodized aluminum heatsink

bitaxe_gamma_turbo_gt.notes: Final and most powerful BitAxe revision. Dual BM1370 chips on one board. Assembled in USA. USB-C for firmware updates. Same per-chip efficiency as Antminer S21 Pro.

antminer_s17.name: Bitmain Antminer S17

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled, adjustable via web UI

antminer_s17.notes: Released April 2019. First miner to use BM1397 7nm chip. Same chip used in BitAxe Max and GekkoScience Compac F. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

antminer_s17_pro.name: Bitmain Antminer S17 Pro

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled, three operating modes (Low Power, Normal, High Performance)

antminer_s17_pro.notes: Released April 2019. Three power modes for different efficiency/performance trade-offs. Same BM1397 chip used in BitAxe Max. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

antminer_s19j_pro.name: Bitmain Antminer S19j Pro

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled, adjustable via web UI

antminer_s19j_pro.notes: Released June 2021. Most popular S19 variant. Available in 92/96/100/104 TH/s bins. Supports Braiins OS for autotuning. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

whatsminer_m30s_plus.name: MicroBT Whatsminer M30S+
whatsminer_m30s_plus.notes: Mid-range M30S variant. 17% more hashrate than M30S at similar power draw. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

whatsminer_m30s_plusplus.name: MicroBT Whatsminer M30S++
whatsminer_m30s_plusplus.notes: Released October 2020. Top-tier M30S variant. 31 J/TH makes it one of the most efficient 8nm miners. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

whatsminer_m50.name: MicroBT Whatsminer M50
whatsminer_m50.power_input: 220-240V AC, P221B/P222B PSU, IEC C19 cable rated 16A+
whatsminer_m50.notes: Released April 2022. First M-series with Samsung 5nm process. Advanced thermal architecture. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

heatbit_original.name: Heatbit (Original)

temperature.notes: Built-in overheat protection and automatic shutdown. Designed for safe home operation.

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled, not user-adjustable

heatbit_original.notes: First-generation mining heater. Reworked Antminer S9 ASIC redesigned for silent, safe home operation. Heats ~170 sq ft. Replaced by Heatbit Trio.

heatbit_trio.name: Heatbit Trio

temperature.notes: Built-in overheat protection and automatic shutdown. Built-in thermostat for room temperature regulation.

fan.type: Internal silent cooling system with HEPA air filter
fan.notes: Triple function: miner cooling, space heating, air purification

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled, not user-adjustable

voltage.notes: Built-in PSU, compatible with North American (110-120V) and European (220-240V) standards

heatbit_trio.notes: Triple-function device: Bitcoin miner, space heater, and HEPA air purifier. Heats up to 400 sq ft. Mining at 400W with optional 1000W heating boost. Built-in thermostat saves up to 30% running costs. Ships to US and Canada.

bitchimney.name: BitChimney Space Heater
bitchimney.asic_chip: BM1366 or BM1362 (depends on S19 hashboard variant used)
bitchimney.asic_chip_source: Repurposed single Antminer S19/S19j/S19k Pro/S21 hashboard

temperature.notes: Temperature range depends on which hashboard variant is installed. S19-based boards follow Antminer S19 thermal profiles.

fan.type: Internal fans in enclosed heater shell
fan.notes: Designed for quiet home operation. Stock noise ~49-53 dB. S21 version ~56 dB in high mode.

frequency.notes: Managed by aftermarket firmware (BraiinsOS, Vnish, or LuxOS). Underclocked for 120V operation.

voltage.notes: APW3++ PSU modified to output 13.6V. At 120V input, limited to ~1200W. At 240V, up to 1500W.

bitchimney.interface: BraiinsOS / Vnish / LuxOS Web UI + API
bitchimney.form_factor: Enclosed space heater (3D printable design, open source)
bitchimney.notes: DIY space heater miner. Uses single S19/S21 hashboard. Design files are open source (CC-NC). LuxOS firmware has 2.8% dev fee but waives Luxor Pool fees. Compatible hashboards: S19j, S19j Pro, S19j Pro+, S19k Pro, S21 (NOT 88-chip S19 boards). Manufactured in Canada by D-Central, shipped from St. Louis, MO.

canaan_avalon_a1266.name: Canaan Avalon Made A1266

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled

canaan_avalon_a1266.notes: Released November 2022. Industrial Canaan miner. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

canaan_avalon_a1346.name: Canaan Avalon Made A1346

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled

canaan_avalon_a1346.notes: Available in multiple hashrate bins (104T-126T). Improved efficiency over A1266. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

canaan_avalon_a1466.name: Canaan Avalon Made A1466

frequency.notes: Firmware-controlled

canaan_avalon_a1466.notes: Released September 2023. Canaan's most efficient industrial miner. 50% more hashrate than A1266 at lower power. Immersion variant A1466I offers 170 TH/s at 19.5 J/TH. NOT suitable for home without noise/heat mitigation.

BM1387.notes: Most produced Bitcoin ASIC chip in history

BM1366.notes: Rolls more than just the nonce on-chip, allowing longer serial chains. Different footprint/pinout from BM1397/BM1387.

BM1368.notes: Improved heat dissipation structure vs BM1366. Higher power per chip but better thermal stability.

BM1370.notes: Most efficient current-gen Bitmain chip. At 1 TH/s: consumes 15W (vs 19W for BM1366). Same chip in $8000 Antminer S21 Pro and $100 BitAxe Gamma.

BM1398.notes: S19-series chip. Not to be confused with BM1362. 76 chips per hashboard, 3 boards per miner. Temperature dramatically impacts efficiency.

BM1362.notes: Used in GekkoScience Compac A1 USB miner. 70% more power efficient than BM1397.

cgminer_api.name: CGMiner / BMMiner API
cgminer_api.notes: Antminers use BMMiner (CGMiner fork). GekkoScience uses cgminer-gekko fork. Whatsminer uses their own CGMiner variant.

canaan_web_ui.name: Canaan Web UI + Avalon Family App
canaan_web_ui.notes: Canaan devices use proprietary web interface. Avalon Family App for mobile control. Some models support CGMiner API via AUC (Avalon USB Converter) for older Avalon miners.

futurebit_web_ui.name: FutureBit Web UI
futurebit_web_ui.notes: Custom Linux-based OS with web dashboard. Built-in stratum solo pool server.

thermal_profiles._description: Thermal profiles for fleet management software. Maps device families to their normal operating ranges. Temperatures OUTSIDE these ranges should trigger alerts.

GekkoScience.notes: No built-in temp sensor. These thresholds are for external monitoring only.

AvalonNano3s.notes: CRITICAL: These Canaan chips are designed for high-temp operation (75-95C is NORMAL). Do NOT alert at 85-95C. Mining mode: 75C, Night mode: 80C, Heater mode: 90C. Chips perform better at higher temps.

AvalonMini3.notes: Same A15-series high-temp chips as Nano 3S. 75-90C is normal across all modes.

AntminerS9.notes: BM1387 chips run 85-100C NORMALLY. Do NOT alert at these temps. Below 85C = cool. 85-100C = normal. 105C+ = warning. 115C = firmware auto-cutoff.

AntminerS19.notes: BM1398/BM1366 chips. PCB max ~75-80C. Chip max 95C firmware shutdown. Temperature dramatically impacts efficiency on this generation.

BitChimney.notes: Thermal profile depends on installed hashboard (S19 or S21). Follows same profile as parent miner type.

home_suitability_ratings._description: Quick reference for which devices are practical for home use without modifications

excellent.description: Designed specifically for home use. Quiet, low power, plug-and-play.

good.description: Suitable for home with some considerations (noise, power, heat).

marginal.description: Possible at home with significant modifications (noise insulation, dedicated circuit, ventilation).
devices: Antminer S9 (with Braiins OS space heater mode)

not_recommended.description: Industrial miners. Require dedicated space, 240V circuit, serious noise/heat management.
